2006/9/13, Neil Swingler <neil@...>:
>
> Surely even if java 5 is not permitted in production code there can be
> no harm in using it to run a unit testing tool. Indeed starting with
> java 5 features in unit tests would be a good way to practice them
> without risking all on the production code.
>
> - Neil
>


I did this when developing some stuff for MHP which is only guaranteed to
support some very old JDKs. I think it was 1.1 or 1.2. I set the ant script
to build the production code with target="1.2" or such. Wanted to try out
JDK5 features and JUnit4. Worked fine for me, but I can see it might be
difficult in corporate environments. I was in a situation where I was able
to try things out so its a bit different.

-Teemu
